item.title: Cisco Validated Design for Panasonic: A Blueprint for IP Media Success
item.description: Cisco and Panasonic have collaborated to create a Cisco Validated Design (CVD) aimed at enhancing IP infrastructure for media broadcasters. This design ensures reliable, scalable support for high-resolution video formats like UHD/4K and beyond. The CVD is rigorously tested for interoperability, providing a trusted blueprint for organizations. It helps accelerate deployments while minimizing risk, ensuring all components work seamlessly together for high-quality live production. This…

item.title: Announcing the New Nexus Dashboard for Simplifying Data Center Operations in the AI Era
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for data center operations! Nexus Dashboard 4.1 is now available, offering complete lifecycle management for multiple data center networks through a single interface. This solution simplifies provisioning and enhances visibility while providing diagnostics and automation. It supports various environments, including NX-OS, ACI, AI fabrics, and more. The dashboard also enables VXLAN EVPN automation on Cisco Catalyst switches. #DataCenter #NexusDashboard #AI #NetworkManagement…

item.title: Announcing the New Nexus Dashboard for Simplifying Data Center Operations in the AI Era
item.description: üåê Exciting news in data center management! The Nexus Dashboard 4.1 is now available for unified lifecycle management of multiple data center networks. This single interface streamlines provisioning and enhances visibility, making it easier for teams to manage diverse environments. It supports various network fabrics, including NX-OS and ACI, while offering robust automation and diagnostics. This advancement aims to simplify operations in an increasingly AI-driven landscape. #DataCenter…

item.title: The data catalyst: Blended finance paving the way for climate AI solutions
item.description: üåç The Cisco Foundation highlights the role of blended finance in addressing the data-to-scale gap for climate AI solutions. AI can significantly impact climate innovation, but it requires access to diverse, quality data, which is often costly. Cisco recently hosted an AI + Climate Innovation Lab, uniting over 100 experts to explore data needs in various climate sectors. Together, these efforts aim to enhance climate tech funding and innovation. üí°üìä #ClimateAI #BlendedFinance #DataForClimate…

item.title: The data catalyst: Blended finance paving the way for climate AI solutions
item.description: The Cisco Foundation is exploring blended finance to tackle the data accessibility challenges for climate AI solutions. üåç During the AI + Climate Innovation Lab at San Francisco Climate Week 2025, over 100 experts discussed the critical need for diverse and high-quality data across various climate sectors. This initiative aims to bridge the gap in funding and data for climate tech innovation. üí° #ClimateAI #DataForGood #Sustainability #Innovation #BlendedFinance

item.title: Advancing U.S. AI Leadership: Cisco to Skill 1 Million People
item.description: Cisco is committed to enhancing AI education in the U.S. üåü As part of the White House’s Pledge to America‚Äôs Youth, they plan to train 1 million people in AI and digital skills over the next four years via Learn with Cisco. item.title: Advancing U.S. AI Leadership: Cisco to Skill 1 Million People

item.title: Bringing Some Source of Truth to Your NetAI Agentic Playground
item.description: Exploring the integration of AI in network engineering, Hank Preston discusses the importance of source-of-truth data for NetAI agents. In his latest article, he reflects on using Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to enhance AI’s ability to interact with network devices. The focus is on providing AI agents access to essential data, boosting their effectiveness. NetBox, an open-source tool, is highlighted for its role in this process, enabling better data accessibility for AI applications….

item.title: Bringing Some Source of Truth to Your NetAI Agentic Playground
item.description: Exploring the integration of AI in network engineering, the article discusses the importance of providing source-of-truth data to AI agents. The author shares insights on using Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to enhance AI interactions with network devices. A key focus is on leveraging NetBox, an open-source tool, to supply vital data for AI operations. This approach aims to empower AI agents to function like human engineers. #NetAI #AIinNetworking #NetworkAutomation #TechInsights…

item.title: Is Reactive IT Finally Dead?
item.description: üö® Is Reactive IT Finally Dead? üö® In a recent article, Cisco’s Jason Coleman highlights the challenges of reactive IT. Engineers often spend over 150 hours a year addressing unexpected outages, leading to high costs and operational risks. Cisco is shifting towards AI-powered, preemptive IT solutions to combat these issues, aiming to minimize downtime and enhance efficiency. Learn more about this important shift in IT management! #Cisco #ReactiveIT #AITechnology #ITManagement #TechTrends

item.title: Is Reactive IT Finally Dead?
item.description: üö® Is Reactive IT Finally Dead? üö® Jason Coleman from Cisco discusses the challenges of reactive IT, where engineers spend over 150 hours annually fixing unexpected outages. This approach leads to high costs and operational risks for businesses. Cisco is shifting towards AI-powered, preemptive IT solutions to enhance network reliability and reduce downtime. Learn more about this important transition in IT management! #ITManagement #Cisco #AI #TechTrends #NetworkReliability

item.title: Conference Hopping: Training Attendee Scanning Def Con
item.description: üö® The Black Hat NOC faces unique challenges, as it operates in a cybersecurity hub where scanning and ethical hacking are expected. Cisco is enhancing security with network-based telemetry to monitor diverse personal devices at the conference. An alert recently identified suspicious activity linked to a training session targeting an external IP associated with Def Con. #Cybersecurity #BlackHat2025 #Cisco #ThreatDetection #EthicalHacking

The Cisco team ensures stable connectivity and monitors traffic to protect against unauthorized attacks. SnortML, Cisco’s machine learning tool, demonstrated high accuracy, detecting over 100 attacks with only 21 false positives. Stay informed about cybersecurity innovations! üîíüíª #Cisco #BlackHat2025 #Cybersecurity…

item.title: The Value of PCAP in Firewall Investigations
item.description: üöÄ The article highlights the importance of PCAP (packet capture) in firewall investigations, emphasizing its time-consuming nature. Key steps include finding a suitable platform, executing the capture, and analyzing large files. At Black Hat USA 2025, the ‚ÄòEndace PCAP Pivot‚Äô feature enabled easier access to packet-level data, enhancing SOC analyst investigations significantly. üìäüîç #CyberSecurity #PacketCapture #NetworkAnalysis #BlackHat2025 #SOCInsights

item.description: üöÄ The Black Hat conference highlights the unique challenges of cybersecurity, particularly within its Security and Network Operations Center (NOC). This dynamic environment differs from typical corporate settings where such actions are seen as malicious. With a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) policy, comprehensive monitoring becomes challenging. Key features include streamlined password management and a new Global Enrollment Policy to simplify onboarding. üîê…

item.title: Securing DNS With Umbrella at Black Hat
item.description: Cisco continues to enhance security at Black Hat, focusing on DNS monitoring since 2017. üåê With Umbrella, they route DNS traffic through a centralized service, gaining insights into potential threats like malware and phishing. At Black Hat USA 2025, encrypted DNS requests were blocked to improve visibility into user traffic. üîç The team prioritized monitoring the ApateWeb PUP delivery and phishing campaign, noting specific domain patterns. #Cisco #BlackHat2025 #CyberSecurity #DNS #Umbrella

item.title: Rebuilding homes and a resilient community in Western North Carolina
item.description: In Western North Carolina, Cisco Crisis Response and 40 Communities are aiding in the recovery from Hurricane Helene. üå™Ô∏è After the storm caused severe damage, affecting over 73,000 homes, a coalition was formed to support local leaders and nonprofits in the rebuilding efforts. üè† Nearly a year later, the focus remains on restoring homes, especially for low-income families, while ensuring vital services are accessible. ü§ù #CommunitySupport #HurricaneHelene #RebuildingTogether #CrisisResponse…

item.title: Start your career in IT with CCST certification
item.description: üöÄ Ready to kickstart your IT career? Cisco’s CCST certification is your gateway! This entry-level certification offers three paths: IT Support, Networking, and Cybersecurity. With no prerequisites, anyone can start learning and gain essential skills. Join over 1.8 million students who have begun their journey with Cisco Networking Academy! #Cisco #ITCareers #CCST #TechTraining #Cybersecurity

item.title: Closing the Backdoor in TACACS+: Why Full-Session Encryption Matters More Than Ever
item.description: üö® Recent cyber threats highlight the risks of weak TACACS+ encryption. Attackers exploited vulnerabilities, targeting network operators to steal credentials and blend in as legitimate admins. By harvesting TACACS+ traffic, they captured sensitive data, allowing unauthorized access and evading detection. Cisco ISE with TLS 1.3 and Duo MFA offers solutions to enhance security and close these backdoors. üîíüõ°Ô∏è #Cybersecurity #TACACS #DataProtection #CiscoISE #MFA

item.title: Detecting Exposed LLM Servers: A Shodan Case Study on Ollama
item.description: üö® A recent case study reveals over 1,100 exposed Ollama LLM servers, with 20% hosting open models. This highlights critical security vulnerabilities in LLM deployments. üîç The study utilized Shodan to identify these unsecured endpoints, emphasizing the need for stronger security measures. üõ°Ô∏è As LLMs become more popular, addressing these gaps is essential for protecting sensitive data. #CyberSecurity #LLM #DataProtection #Ollama #Shodan

item.title: Safeguard Against Data Breaches in Our Next Cisco U. Capture the Flag Challenge
item.description: üõ°Ô∏è Learn about SQL Injection (SQLi) attacks and their impact on database security. These attacks exploit application vulnerabilities to manipulate SQL queries, leading to unauthorized access and data theft. Consequences include credential theft, data alteration, and even system access. Stay informed and protect your digital data! üîê #CyberSecurity #EthicalHacking #SQLInjection #DataProtection #TechAwareness

item.title: Uninterrupted Motion: Why Factories Need a New Class of Wireless

The update aims to strengthen the protection of electronic personal health information (ePHI) and address the increasing number of cyberattacks. Organizations must prepare to implement effective…

By integrating Cisco Email Threat Defense with Splunk‚Äôs analytics, Cisco aims to provide comprehensive protection against evolving threats. #CyberSecurity…

item.title: Fragmented SSE Is a Risk You Can‚Äôt Afford
item.description: Fragmented security solutions can create significant risks. Many organizations rely on multiple vendors for their security needs, leading to complex systems that may leave gaps in protection. Cisco Secure Access addresses this issue by providing a unified architecture. This ensures consistent policy enforcement regardless of where users connect from, enhancing overall security. No more silos or inconsistent access experiences! #Cybersecurity #Cisco #SecureAccess #SSE #DataProtection üîêüåêüíª

These tools aim to enhance security while supporting compliance and zero trust initiatives. As government agencies…

item.title: The power of ten ‚Äî and the power of Purpose
item.description: üöÄ Cisco empowers employees through the Time2Give program, offering ten days off to volunteer and $10,000 in matching donations. In FY25, 81% of employees participated, contributing over 566,000 volunteer hours. This initiative not only supports communities but also enhances employee retention and recognition. Learn more about our impact and future goals for FY26! üåçü§ù #Cisco #CorporateResponsibility #Volunteerism #CommunityImpact #EmployeeEngagement

item.title: Building a Scalable E-Commerce Platform at Cisco: From DevNet to Company-Wide Impact
item.description: üöÄ Cisco’s DevNet initiative has transformed into a scalable e-commerce framework that benefits the entire company. Over two years, the team navigated complex legal and security processes to onboard payment vendors like Stripe and VeriFone, ensuring compliance with international regulations. üåç This groundwork allows Cisco Learning to easily integrate new payment solutions, showcasing the importance of strategic planning for future needs. #Cisco #Ecommerce #DevNet #BusinessGrowth #Innovation

item.title: Wrangling the Wild West of MCP Servers
item.description: üöÄ Ready to build your own Model Context Protocol (MCP) server? In a recent article, Kareem Iskander explains how to leverage your existing APIs using OpenAPI specs. This approach allows you to create an AI-powered gateway for your product with minimal effort. Just a few lines of Python and a FastMCP wrapper can transform your APIs into role-based AI tools without the need for custom definitions. #MCPServer #OpenAPI #AI #APIs #TechTips
